meanings.definition: Give money to (someone) in return for goods or services.
meanings.sent1: I will pay for the groceries at the store.
meanings.sent2: She always pays the mechanic after he fixes her car.
meanings.sent3: I forgot my wallet, so I couldn't pay for the ice cream.
meanings.sent4: He had to pay a hefty sum for breaking the antique vase.
meanings.sent5: The customer must pay the cashier before leaving the shop.

meanings.definition: Give (someone) what is due for work done, services rendered, or debts incurred.
meanings.sent1: The company will pay you for your hard work.
meanings.sent2: He pays his employees every two weeks.
meanings.sent3: I will pay you with cookies for helping me with my homework.
meanings.sent4: She always pays her dues on time.
meanings.sent5: The landlord must pay the repairman for fixing the leaky faucet.

meanings.definition: Suffer a loss or penalty as a result of an action.
meanings.sent1: If you don't study, you will pay the consequences.
meanings.sent2: He paid dearly for his reckless behavior.
meanings.sent3: I forgot my umbrella, so I had to pay the price and got soaked in the rain.
meanings.sent4: She paid the penalty for arriving late to the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The team paid the price for underestimating their opponents.
